title: Three-year-old girl and a man hit by gunfire in Peoria
content:
PEORIA - Shots rang out Thursday night in an area where gunshots are familiar, striking a 3-year-old girl and an adult.
People were on the porch of a home in the 1300 block of South Arago Street about 10:45 p.m. when four shots were fired from the south of the house, police said. A 24- to 26-year-old man who has been tentatively identified was hit in the neck region, while the girl, who was not identified, was struck in the leg. Both victims were taken to an area hospital for treatment.
"Man, they shot my baby," a visibly distraught young man screamed into a cellphone as he walked away from the area of the shootings, unable to cross the crime scene tape strung across the block.
A swarm of officers, including patrol officers, detectives and Peoria County sheriff's deputies were on hand trying to discern what had occurred.
"Somebody's gonna die over this," the same man screamed, before leaving the scene.
Peoria Lt. Kerrie Davis said there was no arguments or fighting before the shootings.
"It was just a small group sitting on the porch," she said.
About a block away, in the 1400 block of the street, a man was shot several times on May 13. His injuries were not life-threatening, according to Journal Star archives. Just two days later, in the same block, more gunfire rang out. It didn't appear anyone was injured then.
On June 13, also in the 1400 block of South Arago Street, an 11-year-old girl was struck by a bullet that penetrated the exterior wall of her home as she slept.
